intro: Rubus rungwensis, commonly known as the Rungwé blackberry, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of eastern Africa, particularly in countries like Uganda and Rwanda. The plant is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves, typical of many Rubus species. Its flowers are small and white, followed by dark purple to black berries that are edible. The plant plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food for various wildlife species.
